On 2/7/06, Ben Maurer <bmaurer@...> wrote:
>
> for (;;) *DOES* h=
ave yield points -- you need it for a correctly
> functioning GC. However, =
java does not use these yield points by
> default, it only uses one with sl=
eep.


No, any API call or even certain Java statements will be preemptable=
 (that's
how threads get scheduled).

To abort a for(;;) I think you need t=
hread.stop.


Yes, stop() will work.  interrupt() won't, though.
